Text: Re Seminar at UH and at UT Cc Latha Thanks for asking Id like to leave San Francisco nonstop to Houston on United at am Jan arriving pm then go to Austin on the late afternoon of the th for a seminar at UT then I need to get from Austin to San Francisco on the evening of the th There is a United flight connecting through Denver that leaves Austin at pm connecting to United out of Denver If there is a nonstop from Austin to San Francisco or San Jose that is even better United my preferred does not have a nonstop from Austin to the Bay Area The cost will be shared with U Texas if thats OK with you and them I have copied the organizer of the seminar there Professor Ron Kaniel Warm regards Darrell Date Tue Nov From Latha Ramchand Subject Seminar at UH To tanfordEDU MIMEversion XMIMEOLE Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V Importance Normal XPriority Normal XMSMailpriority Normal XMSTNEFCorrelator AADBDDBDFCD XUIDL cacdfccbfbbfeb Hi Prof Duffie Just a note to confirm your seminar here at the Bauer College of Business on Janth can we go ahead and make the travel arrangements if yes could you send me your preferences as far as time and dates for travel and also the airport you will be leaving from Thanks Best latha Latha Ramchand Department of Finance CT Bauer College of Business University of Houston Houston TX Tel Fax Darrell Duffie mail GSB Stanford CA USA phone fax email web duffie

Re The first document for audit Cc Vince I read the relibailitybased VAR method document with interest Here are some comments The document falls short of describing how to use the method in practice but rather gives some general motivation I am confident that I myself could not develop an algorithm based on this document unless all of the derivative valuation functions are explicit and rather nice functions with explicit derivatives of the underlying variables in which case the VAR problem is not so hard in any case as Monte Carlo is very effective in this case My comment here is critical of exposition I do not suggest that the proposed method is weak The remark p that my paper with Jun Pan addresses only normal returns is not correct The main point of our paper was to allow for jumps including fat tails and skewness The comment that we rely on deltagamma is a good criticismand the main potential advantage of the reliability approach if it works in practical cases There is a typo at page at lines from the bottom where I presume gTu not gTx There is a missing we on page lines from the bottom The remark on CPU time page does not mention what machine was used The example page does not really have much nonnormality Skewness and kurtosis is this excess kurtosis are not much compared to most practical cases in which kurtosis is an extra order of magnitude with lots of skewness Overall the paper piqued my curiosity a lot and left me wanting more clarity and a cookbook I hope events at Enron have not made things difficult for you I will later bill you for one hour if that is OK Warmest personal regards Darrell XMimeOLE Produced By Microsoft Exchange V contentclass urncontentclassesmessage MIMEVersion Subject The first document for audit Date Mon Jul XMSHasAttach XMSTNEFCorrelator ThreadTopic The first document for audit ThreadIndex AcEOHtYrCeSfbQQuWMfwNSwcgg From Kaminski Vince J To tanfordEDU Cc XOriginalArrivalTime Jul UTC FILETIMEADEACEF XUIDL cdbedddbf Darrell I am sending you the first document for review Its a new algorithm invented by Rabi De and Tanya The credit paper has been written but it needs more work before we can send it to you I think you will enjoy the document I am attaching Vince ReliabiliyVARdoc Darrell Duffie mail GSB Stanford CA USA phone fax email web duffie
